p: As observed by Virchow [ 27] and borne out by accumulated public health data over the ages, pathogens causing epidemics and pandemics are emerging and reemerging at random. Recently, specifically on 17th July 2019, the WHO declared the Ebolavirus disease (EVD, or Ebola) outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) [ 175]. We believe that the four-pronged approach developed by us [ 28] and discussed in more details in this article may provide a starting point to develop “generic approaches” for the management of emerging global pathogens in an effective manner.
